column4: well, I just installed 5.10, and now I need the root pw to mount a floppy, but I wassn't given a chance to create one during the install... how do I fix this?  thanks
If you must have a root terminal, sudo -s will do it for you
how would I get firestarter to load/start automatically at boot... thanks
You will have to disable the sudo password for firestarter to auto-load
that doesn't seem to good... is the firewall running in stealth mode by default?
you can disable the password JUST for firestarter if you want
there are 0 open ports on ubuntu by default
does 0 ports equal good firewall setup?
0 ports = no reason for a firewall actually
Microsoft windows has many open ports by default
thanks for your help... gotta go.... sorry to run
